tweets.text:
There are still a number of flood warnings in place across England. 

Avoid walking or driving through flood water ‚ö†Ô∏è

Check your #flood risk: https://t.co/BpUpnjiX4L https://t.co/pyyYmPFIoR

There is a Flood Warning in place for The River Coln at Fairford and Lechlade.  Property flooding is expected overnight tonight 27/12/2020, especially in the Fairford and Lechlade on Thames areas. Follow @EnvAgency and #floodaware on Twitter for regular updates https://t.co/8JXhhasQsb

tweets.text: Just been talking with the @EnvAgencyNW #Cumbria and #Lancashire teams - looks like cold and wintry showers for today.  We also discussed how we can send support to other Area teams who are still dealing with flooding #teamEA https://t.co/SmvY1S1TZW

When rivers are flooded, the current can be strong enough to sweep you away.

We're expecting further river #flooding across central and east England.
 
Check your #flood risk: https://t.co/BpUpnjiX4L https://t.co/QRCVJJglYb

#TRRP have been looking out for opportunities to add woody material to brooks & springs, to help slow water during floods and improve habitats! Leaky dams are already provided by nature, see if you can spot one on your next walk! üö∂Thanks to the @EnvAgency for its support! #WEG https://t.co/IOz5WV8kF9

tweets.text: @PaulBurrowsy @EnvAgencyAnglia thank you paul, I‚Äôm visiting Earith sluice next time I‚Äôm that way
2) The mouth of the Ouse Washes @EnvAgencyAnglia https://t.co/CpaNBxjzKC

1/3 A very similar picture to yesterday in the Somerset Levels and Moors: Hookbridge, Beazleys and Allermoor spillways continue to run and upstream pumps will remain off until river levels allow them to resume. https://t.co/UXFWCYHrRu

I‚Äôm no hydrologist expert but even I was getting worried about water levels in Buckingham in the early afternoon of 23/12 but sadly @EnvAgencyAnglia ignored their own telemetry and didn‚Äôt call it a flood until circa 23:15 - which was far too late. https://t.co/mwx1ruiN90

Our teams have been out across the region, checking defences and clearing trash screens following the impacts of #StormBella. Stay vigilant, check your local flood risk at https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/djrnjrBY0t

Operational check call with the @EnvAgencyYNE incident duty team for the North & East of #Yorkshire today. We continue to have teams out checking & operating flood defence assets including the #FossBarrier in #York. If you see our teams out and about please help to keep them safe https://t.co/bz5CzpcW02

tweets.text:
Thank Stewart excellent job @EnvAgencyNW do.

Likewise @LancasterCC haven't been taking any chances. 

Out this afternoon and evening sweeping channels in flood prone areas. https://t.co/mrKlLx0tpa https://t.co/4VGwKR4rO3

We have reports of people in flood waters. Please do not walk, swim or drive through flood water. The rivers are flowing very quickly & you can‚Äôt tell where the edge of the path meet the river. There's many hidden dangers inc raised manhole covers & 30cm of water can move a car.

tweets.text: CEVs Paul and Peter with the 10:30am report. River level 28mAOD with the river level steady currently and just breaching the bullpit. Stear clear of flood water. @DWFRSBoA @BoATownCouncil @Trow_Fire_Stn @EnvAgencySW @WiltshireWinter https://t.co/5StC4kjMMW
Marred slightly by the massive bog caused by the long-standing flooding at the East entrance! Please sort this out @thameswater @harrow_council @EnvAgency @NLCS1850 https://t.co/JETDkYZ8NN
Barriers out in Bradford on Avon and starting to do their job. EA field teams on site. Expecting the peak mid afternoon. @EnvAgencySW https://t.co/hoaKlXxifE

tweets.text:
River Thames lapping over the #ThamesPath outside @HobbsofHenley this morning.
Thankfully, river levels upstream are levelling/dropping and dry weather forecast.
Stay safe and check @EnvAgencySE #floods pages https://t.co/3COnuR8oGD
@henleystandard @river_rowing https://t.co/yNQ58H1j5b

tweets.text: Work back underway at Cowick today, looking to strengthen the breach repair works on the Aire & Calder.  @CRTYorkshireNE @EnvAgencyYNE @ERfloodrisk https://t.co/9YayPQDfMx

Due to recent heavy rainfall, river #flooding is likely in parts of central and east England.

Always stay away from flooded rivers.

Check your flood risk now: https://t.co/BpUpnj1mdd

#StormBella https://t.co/d3sZWbkXBz
@GSwinburn @Conservatives @BorisJohnson @EnvAgencyYNE He didn‚Äôt come to see anything, he came because all the tv cameras were there, absolute token gesture for his own publicity.

tweets.text: We have operated the #Jubilee River to gate movement 1 ,this will alleviate  flows in the #Cookham area. @EnvAgencySE @MarkHill03 @johncurtinEA @SteveMooreEA @wifo_ea

9.40am, Monday

We still many flood warnings and alerts in place...

Please check your area...

Get the latest here: https://t.co/3BhMIvEYbG

Plus great advice... like moving valuables upstairs, and putting medicines in a bag...
#floodaware https://t.co/PXlIJe8zVh
Work back underway at Cowick today, looking to strengthen the breach repair works on the Aire & Calder.  @CRTYorkshireNE @EnvAgencyYNE @ERfloodrisk https://t.co/r4pFf6LvEM

tweets.text: @BedsFire would like to thank those who gave up their time to support the response to the flooding in our communities. A huge thanks to @BedfordTweets @bedspolice and @EnvAgency local flood groups, volunteer groups and the offers of support we received from the public #ThankYou https://t.co/7QTZrSiXme

@GSwinburn @Conservatives @BorisJohnson @EnvAgencyYNE They have, and the flood barriers seem to be working finally, which is great news. I doubt anyone would have given him stick for spending half an hour with his sleeves rolled up putting some graft in.

tweets.text:
Flood Alert remain in force. River Thames at Cookham has risen to 70cm (8.15am) and EA are advising low lying roads in Marlow and Hurley are flooded.  Links to latest @EnvAgencySE status and forecast, river level and more can be found at
https://t.co/sX7AuXL4RE

@announcerphil and if he had filled a few bags he would have been given equal derision from different quarters. No politicians can win.. but to @Conservatives @BorisJohnson credit they have provided ¬£100m to York to reduce flood risks #fossbarrier working hard today @EnvAgencyYNE üôè

tweets.text: Throwback to 5 years ago today when #York was hit by horrific floods so I spent a day filling sandbags to help out, and even the then PM David Cameron turned up....to watch ü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüòÇ https://t.co/SM4DElVCbM

Back on Flood Operations Duty Throughout today, barriers at #Hereford #Shrewsbury #Ironbridge #Bewdley still deployed, gates at #Upton #Uckinghall #Deerhurst #Ashleworth still closed and our teams out checking and operating assets @EnvAgencyMids oh and not forgetting the Snow üò≥ https://t.co/WfTLnuLhep

@ajf350d @WorcsTravel @worcscc @myworcester @BromsgroveDC @RedditchMatters @Wychavon @WyreForestDC @MalvernHills_DC @WMerciaPolice @EnvAgencyMids @DaveThroupEA It doesn‚Äôt work either way. I agree, a direct link is needed üëçüèª

@kreeve @DWFRSBoA @BoATownCouncil @Trow_Fire_Stn @EnvAgencySW @WiltshireWinter Unfortunately we can't prevent flooding (much as we'd like to!) . The best we can do is warn and inform and be the eyes and ears for our community and emergency responder partners on the ground.

Following heavy rainfall yesterday and overnight, we have operated the Foss Barrier to help protect properties in York. In this video, our asset performance advisor Mark Fuller explains how it works #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/mMPzvj913L
Be #floodaware and #staysafe. Check river levels near you and sign up for our flood warning information service here https://t.co/QdPKdEYx15 https://t.co/W29sauPPvF

urls.description: Worcestershire County Council, Worcester, United Kingdom. 15,665 likes ¬∑ 177 talking about this. The official Facebook page for Worcestershire County Council. We're here to help.

tweets.text:
***Roads update***

We've got a series of road closures across Worcestershire with floodwater and overnight snowfall causing some disruption.

Here's a full list via the @worcscc Facebook page: https://t.co/zkr9rK6wgy https://t.co/9qQtC0bohX

tweets.text: @BoATCCEVs @DWFRSBoA @BoATownCouncil @Trow_Fire_Stn @EnvAgencySW @WiltshireWinter Many thanks to the brilliant @BoATCCEVs - while we watch the line on the graph climb upwards they‚Äôre out there preventing flooding!
Gorgeous crisp winters morning in Canons Park https://t.co/ABLiTbPeWC

Part of the monitoring at the @lowthercastle beaver site is by @LancasterUni, to identify how the #beavers influence water flow, and the value of a floodplain during storm events.

By holding water back, beavers play a vital role in #NaturalFloodManagement. #StormBella #Cumbria https://t.co/E7ZWXZjBcK
@lizwatts101 @EnvAgencyAnglia @CambsCC @CambsCops @cambsfrs @SouthCambs I've been down to Earith Bridge this morning and I'm very pleased to say that none of the properties are flooded.

Is this just freak amount of rain when conditions are bad, leading to the Nene Park flood plain doing its job, or are there any other other factors? Easily the highest water levels I've seen in 18 years living nr River Nene in Peterborough @EnvAgencyAnglia? https://t.co/Fwul2e0mSL https://t.co/eTymG5MYCi

MP Responds To More Flooding In York #WeatherAware #FloodRisk #StormBella @EnvAgency

The River Aire burst its banks this morning; here's a short clip of what would usually be agricultural fields instead are now one very big lake.
@RSPBAireValley @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/5v292VGMXy

Teams continue to #inspect and #operate flood defences in the @EnvAgencyYNE patch today.
